It might also be helpful to seek the support of a couples therapist or counselor to work through these issues together. Remember that relationships require effort and compromise from both parties, so don't hesitate to seek help if needed.

seeker_post: I have an important job interview coming up, and I can't shake off this anxiety. I don't know how to handle it.
response_post:
It's completely normal to feel anxious before a job interview, but there are some strategies you can use to help manage your anxiety. One helpful tip is to prepare thoroughly for the interview by researching the company, practicing common interview questions, and rehearsing your responses. This can help boost your confidence and reduce anxiety.

Additionally, try to focus on your breathing and practice relaxation techniques such as deep breathing or meditation to help calm your nerves. Remember to get a good night's sleep before the interview and eat a healthy meal to fuel your body and mind.

Lastly, remember that it's okay to feel nervous, but try to reframe your mindset and see the interview as an opportunity to showcase your skills and qualifications. You've got this! Good luck with your interview.

seeker_post: About a year ago, I survived a sexual assault and since then, I find it really hard to open up and trust people. I'm scared to get close to anyone now.
